text:
The task 'style' uses
org/apache/xalan/xslt/XSLTProcessorFactory
to work but 
http://xml.apache.org/xalan-
j/compat_apidocs/org/apache/xalan/xslt/XSLTProcessorFactory.html
says:
Deprecated. This compatibility layer will be removed in later releases. 
public class XSLTProcessorFactory

And it is deleted really. 
How can I execute style task?
creator: bedal@mw.narzan.com
sbailliez@apache.org
text:
<style processor="(trax|xalan|xslp)" ...>

'trax' = any TRaX processor (Xalan2, Saxon...), this is the default if you 
don't specify any processor
'xalan' = Xalan1
'xslp' = XSL:P

creator: bedal@mw.narzan.com
text:
I still think it is a bug:

processor="xalan" produces:
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/xalan/xslt/XSLTProcessorFactory
	at org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.XalanLiaison.<init>
(XalanLiaison.java:82)
...

processor="trax" produces:
javax.xml.transform.TransformerFactoryConfigurationError: Provider 
org.apache.xalan.processor.TransformerFactoryImpl not found
	at javax.xml.transform.TransformerFactory.newInstance
(TransformerFactory.java:110)
	at org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.TraXLiaison.<init>
(TraXLiaison.java:93)

ant 1.4 and xalan-j_2_3_1/bin/xalan.jar were used

could this be a classpath issue - see Bug 6606.

Where is xalan.jar and where is optional.jar?
creator: bodewig@apache.org

text:
both are in classpath. optional.jar is used by some projects and it works.
Setting xalan.jar into classpath environment variable and/or to
<style 
  style="xslt.xml" 
  processor="trax" 
  in="in.xml" 
  out="out.xml" 
  classpath="/prg/java/xalan-j_2_3_1/bin/xalan.jar"
>

changes nothing
creator: bedal@mw.narzan.com
bedal@mw.narzan.com
text: Yes it is OK now, thanks.
